captions.text: jINXtaku13 asks
Since you guys didn't go to Korea for a study aboard program
how'd you make friends?
Did you guys have Korean friends before hand
or did you have friends at work?
Whooh that's actually a good question
Yes it is
Actually being lonely in Korea
can be the major reason that someone might head home
Yet it seems if you come to Korea specifically
to like learn the Korean language
or go to an university here like on an exchange
You have a lot of people you can choose from to be friend with
and everyone is like
"GO KOREA"
because they are all here together
And you are all pretty much the same age group as well
if you are students in Korea
And it gives you many opportunity to meet Korea people
at your university as well as the foreign people living in your dorm
But here as a teacher there are two different options
Either in teaching privately or publicly
If you are teaching in a private school or hakwon
then you'll be lucky enough to have other foreigners with you
in the school
and they can initiate you to the happenings of the city
so they can show you where the foreigner bar is
they can tell you about the different clubs where they went out
so it's a little  easier for you in that way
BUT if you are a public school teacher
then you are the only foreigner at you job
If you work in a public school like elementary,middle or high school
You will be usually be the only person in the whole school
And from there you have to narrow it down to the some amount of people that
actually speak English
Because you are there to teach English
not there to learn Korean
So that pile of teachers at the school has now narrowed down to
significantly tothe people who speaks English
I would usually say it's between 3 and 8 people
Yah...my school had like 6 or so I think..
I had about like 8 people
maybe 3 of them had like really good English
Better than Martina though
there was 5 English teachers there
and 2 of them were like
"WTH! Which one of us suck at English?"
So what happened to my situation was that
then I was in an awkward position
because pretty much all the English teachers there
were older  married women with kids
So it was little bit awkward for me to be friends with them
because in Korea it's just not appropriate
for married guy to be friends with a married Korean woman
And for couple of  the single girls
it was also inappropriate because I'm a married guy
and I shouldn't be making friends with them
Now of course, when we were teaching in Canada
that didn't really matter
you became friends with anyone in your office
like you went out with them
you had meetings with them
In Korea, you have like this social level
which creates a little bit of awkwardness when making friends
Even at your school
the person you became friends with
had like awkward social gap
Yah...actually the closest friend in Korea Seok Bok
Say hi to Seok Bok, everyone!!
We met in my school and she's older than me
so technically in Korea we are not suppose to be friends
She should be like an older person
but if she told me that if I called her Ajumma
She will kill me
You are suppose to, according to the rules of engagement
Be friends with people in your age
but since she was older than you
that was little bit awkward sometimes supposedly at school
It wasn't awkward for us, of course we didn't really care
but other people were kind of like
"Oh...that's really unusual that they are friends"
"Weird...."
Kind of an unusual thing
So outside of school which you spend most time in
If you don't find anyone that you mash well with
you go back to your apartment and that's it
There's literally no one around
You have to make an effort to go up and meet other people in Korea
and it's not as traditional as that you are used to
you know what I mean?
So for example, you've been here in Korea for a little bit awhile
and you haven't made many friends
and when you see a foreigner in the streets, you go like
"Ah!!! My god...It's someone like me.."
And then you run up to them and start talking
and you can develop a friendship that way
While in North America, if you ran up to a stranger
and be like OMG, It's a foreigner
it might be a little bit awkward
You're kind of  a crazy puppy, you're like
"Would you be friends like me????"
"We can be friends.."
Actually good friends of us in Korea appoarch us that way as well
What's up Isabelle? We're talking about you!
Except for running around in the streets
if you are lucky enough to have a foreign bar nearby
that is a really great way to meet people
But again, it's also socially weird
Because it kind of throws away those ideas of coming in with friends
and sticking with friends
You kind of like float, like you might go in there alone
and you might see a group of people
and go up to them and say
"Hi, I'm new, where are you from? What's your name?"
It's almost like being in junior kindergarden again, isn't it?
Yah...
Hey guys...can I have you toys...?Can I play with you?
Because if you don't do that..
you will not make any friends
There is no way to make friends without getting yourself out there
There are other ways to get involved with meeting other people in Korea
like different language cafes
or different trips that you can go on
to different programs
Yah, they have like adventure trips that you can get together
and go ski boarding and snow boarding
Ski boarding?
What's ski boarding???
Ski boarding is when you take your skis
and strap them on to your snow boards
and you snowboard like that
and then you go off like a jump
you let go off it and it's like a little rocket chipping out of it
and you're like....
and you hop on boards and you land on it
God.. did you just made that up?
I did make it up
That's why I don't have any friends
I'll be your best friend
Do you wanna go out on a date?
That sounds like a really good time
Hey
Hey
Why don't we just get married
We should do that
I like you...
Do you wanna get a dog?
Let's get an ugly dog
Let's name him Spudgy
and dye him blue
and then we'll spend all of our time in our apartment making videos
and do not socialize
I'd just realized that we are really awkward people
WHAT??? Why would you say that
Turtle
I really think that being a foreigner in Korea
who has been here for awhile
somewhat being like a vampire
Is it because you are sexy and hot?
Well, that's one of them but there is another ...
Is it because that you sleep at your night time all the time?
That was a trick question
because vampires sleep during the day
Is it because I burn easily on the sun?
That's one of them
Because my skin really pale?
No..actually there is a point I'm trying to get in
OH.....Please go ahead
Whenever you watch a vampire movie or a TV shows
you always hear about the older vampires saying about
how upset they are because they can't really make friends
or family with anyone because they are gonna die and just drop off
The same thing kind of happens in Korea
in  like in a micro level
because if you have been here a few years like we have
We have had friends like one year and then drop off
and then a new friend will come in
and they would like move away to another country
We have been friends with them for like two years
and then we're like
"We've found our best friends!!"
and they are like
"We are going to move away.."
We're like
We're like mini vampires here
That's one of the sucky parts
Get it???
SUCKY
VAMPIRE!!
So when you are
you have to be proactive when you are making friends in Korea
You have to go to them and find them
Anyways, if you've had other ways to make friends
let us know in the comments
Or if you want to be my best friends
let me know on the comment
oh let's leave a comment to Simon that his best friend is Martina
Yes
YAH!!!
Beat you guys to it
We're best friends..
Let's go play Cantan, not that we're addicted
So that's it for today's TL:DR
If you have questions for next TL:DR
leave your question in the comment section below
And make sure you've checked out the the questions that were already asked
You can thumb them up
or thumb them down
And the ones that get to the top
we might just choose those
or we might choose another ones that has no thumbs up that we like
Were we suppose to answer about the babies last week?
oh...but we had to cut off for ....right
ok ...Let's try it again
Seriously... so.. here's the real thing
The thing about having babies...it should...

comments.text:
Hahaha, this is so true....all of my best friends here I met by running up 
into them in the streets with "OMG A WHITE PERSON" look on my face. That 
led to the awkward social pool which is our foreigner bar, which rapidly 
became my second home.

PS Ski boards are just significantly shorter, thicker skis.﻿
